Reviews.Title: “WHAT A NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: CARLOSBARRETO
Reviews.Content: Although the reservation has been made with errors at the reception all been solved with efficiency and sympathy. The dining room has a beautiful view and breakfast was complete and varied with good quality. The hotel is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Full value for money”
Reviews.Author: uahcmsar
Reviews.Content: Low price, central location with good access to public transport. Fairly big rooms and bathroom with tub. A bit noisy from street, wireless only in lobby

Reviews.Title: “Room was Robbed”
Reviews.Author: iggyonthego
Reviews.Content: My room was robbed while I stayed there. I made a report to the police and the manager with no luck. My door was always locked. The only people with access to my room was cleaning personel and staff. The police I spoke with told me that this was not the first time he'd been to this hotel for this. When I notice the theft I also noticed that while my bed had been made nothing else had be cleaned. Toilet paper was still empty, garbage bin was still full. Towels were still dirty and on the floor. Floor itself was needing vacuuming. But iPad2, iPod Nano, Fendi Glasses, Violin accessories, jewelery, and other stuff was missing. Which led me to the conclusion that the woman who cleaned my room was so busy going through my stuff that she had no time to notice the pertinent cleaning jobs needing to be done. The manager Andreas did nothing but give me false hope of filing an insurance claim with the hotel insurance, which I knew was not going to happen. A total loss of over $2000. No security cameras or notes of who cleaned my room and when to be relied upon. Basically stay away and find a hotel with decent security.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Alexs257
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before on a number of occasions and would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in the Kudamm. Clean,comfortable,and excellent value. You won't get a minibar or evening meal,but you will get an excellent place to stay while enjoying Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Helen007
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here previously when it was called the Agon Opera so we knew the location was great for public transport. Emailed beforehand to request a room overlooking Kurfurstendamm and that is exactly what we got, great view of the lights outside. We arrived at 11pm after getting off the train at the wrong stop - unfortunately the only place we could get food at that time was the Subway next door and it was inedible. We also tried to get a bottle of wine at the hotel bar but the lady said they did not sell wine at all. So we had to make do with 2 cups of coffee - not a great start. Breakfast was good, lovely views and included in the price of the room. Our room (408) was fairly spacious with a nice bathroom, no complaints at all. They also stored our luggage on the day of departure as our flight was late evening. Had lunch in Ka De We store one day in the fish bar, it was lovely but don't try and take any pictures of the chef!! We went to various Xmas markets, the nicest of which was at Schloss Charlottenburg - don't bother going in the palace itself though, very expensive and the staff were quite rude, also there is not much to see in there. We probably won't return to Berlin as we have been there twice now but I would recommend this hotel as a great no frills hotel near public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: LoneBrit
Reviews.Content: A friendly, comfortable hotel with clean, modern looking rooms and a decent breakfast. (beware of the fruit - the melon balls were still frozen, but generally the breakfast compares well to what you could get outside for the price). Staff were friendly - though I was unimpressed when they changed my room and phoned me late at night after I'd gone to bed to tell me so. The initial room was quite spacious with a bath. the smaller single room was adequate but no bath. It did have the advantage of a balcony. Rooms contained easy to use safe, but no tea / coffee facilities. No internet terminals in hotel (but can be accessed from a laptop). 24 hour internet available at Adenauerplatz (about 3 minute walk away). Approx 5 minutes to S-Bahn at Savignyplatz - direct line west to Potsdam or east to central and east Berlin. 15 minute walk, along Ku-damm, to Zoo & Kaiser Wilhelm church. Nearest U-Bahn at Adenauerplatz - but requires a change to get to most places of interest so S-Bahn is generally easier. For decent meal at a reasonable price try 'Grafitti' bar / restaurant at Adenauerplatz. Bus 109 from Tegel airport stops almost right outside the hotel (1st stop after Adenauerplatz if coming from the airport) . This bus also stops near Charlottenburg palace and runs along the Ku'damm to the zoo area.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,well worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: Woody067
Reviews.Content: Great location.Set back on a corner at KuDamm.A very busy road but the traffic noise would not discourage me from returning to the hotel. Very good traffic links with the busses and a taxi rank stopping outside and Adeneurplatz U Bahn within 5 minutes walk. The reception staff are welcoming and helpful and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast is continental and food replenished regularly. I have stayed here several times when it was the Agon Opera and the standard has remained good. I would return to this hotel when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A gem at the price.”
Reviews.Author: SCC2104
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel well in advance on the basis that it had good reviews and was very cheap. I visit Berlin every year and, although I knew where this hotel was, I had never stayed there. The location is good and easily reached by bus from the Zoo and Tegal, just take the 109 bus as it stops right outside the hotel. Although Adenauerplatz U-Bahn is a short walk away it is not the best line and neither is Uhlandstrasse, it is better to take the 10 minute walk to Charlottenburg U and S; this saves time and gives access to more routes. The hotel is very clean and the room was warm, clean and well furnished. The bathroom was also clean and spacious compared to many. The room was cleaned daily and all of the staff I encountered were friendly and efficient, not always the case with cheaper hotels. The only negative was the noise from outside. I had a room on the 6th floor overlooking the Ku-damm and I was surprised at the level of noise despite double glazed windows. However I would still choose the same room as the view of the Christmas decorations and the photo opportunity afforded by the balcony outweighs the noise. Will I stay there again; yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: slon2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideal if you want a good, inexpensive stay in Berlin. The rooms are basic but clean with the beds comfortable and the bathroom fine, although bath plug did leak somewhat meaning tap had to be left on during taking of bath. The reception staff were excellent and very approachable with a very good grasp of English. We did not require breakfast in hotel as we are light eaters and used the Back Factory beside the Adenauer U-Bhan which provides a coffee with a choice of pastries and filled rolls for a couple of Euros, The Hotel looks onto the Ku"damm and is easily reached from Schonfeld airport Buy a two hour single ticket costing 3 Euros at the airport. Make sure ticket is stamped and validated at start of journey. Catch one of the frequent buses, X7 or 171, to Rudow U-Bhan. This will take seven minutes journey time. The bus stops outside station and trains leave U-Bhan every 6 minutes. This station is the terminus for the U7 line and will take you to Adenauer U-Bhan in 36 minutes which is only a few minutes from the hotel. My wife and and I have stayed at this Hotel several times including when it was known as the Agon Opera and will continue to use it when returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice located and nice priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIBDK
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is close to perfect, right on Kurfürstendamm. Bus stop is right in front of the Hotel. U-bahn is only 5 minutes away. Booked trough a booking site and got a great deal. Parking behind the hotel in courtyard at 10 EUR pr. day. Room was really nice and clean. Beeds was comfortalble. The room was a bit noisy, facing Kurfüstendamm. Excellent value for your money :-)

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Come Inn Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Sophie S
Reviews.Content: The room was beautifully clean with a spotless bathroom. The reception staff were very helpful and despite us having arrived very very late at night (due to works on the railway lines and much much confusion) we received a warm welcome and they were quite happy to serve us a beer before we headed off to bed. The lady on reception was also very helpful in telling us which trains and buses were the best to get us back to the airport at the end of our stay, as the information we had with us was out of date. We stayed for 6 nights in March which was quite chilly but the hotel was warm and cosy, with duvets on the beds. The position of the hotel is relatively close to the U-Bahn, well within easy walking distance. The hotel is also within good walking distance of several bakers, restaurants, supermarkets, the History of Germany Museum and a theatre. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as were prefer to have breakfast in the city (usually from a baker) - however the breakfast room does boast a lovely view of the city. Great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: xsilo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my girlfriend. The hotel has a good location in the middle of Kurfürstendamm. Good options for car parking. Only 5 minutes by food to the u-bahn. Rooms are light and clean. Over all a very good hotel. Good value for money. Wifi is only available in the reception. It would be nice to have either cable or wifi internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: suemburton
Reviews.Content: We booked the Come Inn on a very cheap deal from Expedia and were very pleased with the value for money. The reception and cleaning staff were very friendly and helpful and the bedroom and bathroom a very good size (a room at the end of one of the corridors) and kept spotlessly clean. The location n the Ku'damm was excellent, walking distance to the city centre and also not far from a U-bahn station. The only downsides were that one of the curtains was missing, which let rather too much light into the room at night and the bath plug did not fit properly, although the shower was good. Would however recommend this hotel, particularly at the good deal we obtained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STM65
Reviews.Content: Good points - Comfortable hotel, with a good breakfast and a great location. Bad points - No clocks/alarm in the room, many half rooms ( Single bed in narrow room), no mini-bar or coffee machine or iron, no WiFi in the hotel room - you need to go to the lobby to connect to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “The Basics”
Reviews.Author: eurolady28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is somewhat spartan.....but, we found the location and cleanliness of this hotel to be really good. The room we had was large and a little noisy because we were on the street side. I think our stay would have been better if the hotel provided a coffee service in the room and a mini-bar or small refrigerator.
